channel.title: InterMine - data integration, analysis, and warehousing
channel.description: Recent content on InterMine - data integration, analysis, and warehousing

item.description: InterMine is part of the Micklem Lab, led by Gos Micklem. Gos is also director of the Cambridge Computational Biology Institute. Gos can often be found writing grants and winning Department of Genetics awards for enthusiastic lecturing. (He says that this was probably a statistical anomaly).

item.title: Learning about InterMine
item.description: Welcome! We’re excited to have you join the community. InterMine integrates biological data, but you don’t have to be a biologist to contribute to InterMine. Some of our entry-level issues only require knowledge of the relevant programming language, but others may require more in-depth understanding. If you’d like to learn a bit more about InterMine, we have a nice 5 minute video for you to sum things up: If you prefer textual learning resources, you could look at the InterMine documentation for a technical overview of InterMine’s server, the FlyMine tutorials for a biologist/bioinformatician oriented overview, or you could hop straight into our Python tutorials to learn more about querying our data model.

item.title: New to open source?
item.description: Perhaps you’ve never made a pull request before, or you’ve used git a little but never collaboratively? Have a look through the open source guide to submitting contributions to give you a good idea of how things work. Some of our issues are marked first-timers-only - these are issues that may be relatively straightforward, where we’ll happily walk you through steps you’re unsure about. (psst, you can also search GitHub for all issues marked with this label, not just InterMine).

Julie joined the InterMine team immediately after graduating with a Computer Science (hons) degree from Bristol University in 2006. She specialises in the InterMine build system and writing meeting agendas.

item.title: Contributing - tickets to try
item.description: Interested in helping out? Here are some of the issues we’re looking for help with. Please read our contributing guidelines first!. OpenTagGrabber.init("intermineIssues","http://tag-grabber.apps.intermine.org/issues");

Software Engineer with 15+ years of experience in web applications development in a variety of industries. Experienced in J2EE open source frameworks, servers, libraries and web services. She joined the InterMine team in 2010, working for 3 years, primarily in the backend development, then she moved away to the game industry but she changed ideas very soon and came back thinking that genes and proteins are more fun than treasures and crowns!

Biologist/bioinformatician with over 10 years experience working with InterMine and complex biological data, she forms the liaison between the biology and the software development. Rachel also runs training workshops for InterMine users and provides help-desk support.

With InterMine since 2007, has worked mostly in the production of modMine (modENCODE project) and ThaleMine (Araport project). Likes databases and data visualization, has produced a music album of his compositions.

Software engineer with a focus on front-end technologies such as Javascript, ClojureScript, and User Interfaces. May be spotted blogging, tweeting from her own account, @intermineorg, @gmodproject, or updating the InterMine homepage. Loves interacting with open source communities. Previously, Yo worked at Capital One and K-Now, a spin-off from the University of Sheffield. In her spare time you can find her running, cycling, or reading speculative fiction.

item.title: API Clients
item.description: We have client libraries to make querying InterMine super-easy! There’s one for each of R, Python, Perl, JavaScript (node or browser), Ruby, and Java

item.title: API Documentation
item.description: Dive straight into our API with interactive live documentation.

item.title: Contributing Guidelines
item.description: InterMine has a large variety of repositories in a number of different languages. We have a list of issues marked up with labels such as “Help Wanted”, “Beginner”, “Good first bug” that you can choose from, but you’re welcome to offer help on any issue if you think you understand what’s going on and what needs to be done. Picking up tasks If you find an issue that interests you, here’s what to do.

item.title: Contributing to InterMine
item.description: If you’d like to start contributing to InterMine, whether you’re a student interested in GSoC, a developer from a lab running InterMine, a Hacktoberfest enthusiast, or something else - here’s what you need to know!

item.title: Developer docs
item.description: Documentation for new and veteran InterMine developers. Includes getting started tutorials, system requirements, configuration info, and troubleshooting tips.

item.title: Developer email list
item.description: Sign up, ask for help, get updates, or just browse the archives to see if a problem you’re having has happened before.

item.title: ISA-InterMine: accelerating and rewarding data sharing
item.description: The ISA-InterMine grant is funded by the Wellcome Trust, collaborating with ISATools in Oxford to integrate ISA metadata into InterMine and make creating InterMine instances quickly and easily on the cloud. Read more details in our announcment blog post. This grant’s start date is April 2018 and it runs for three years.

item.title: InterMine Android and iOS Apps
item.description: InterMine's mobile apps allow you to carry the power of multiple InterMines in your pocket. They include a cross-InterMine search tool, as well as alowing you to browse lists, templates, and to create a selection of "favourites" - perhaps a set of publications to review or a collection of interesting genes. Android Search genes across multiple InterMines, as well as viewing lists, templates, and creating favourites. Developed by Daria Komkova.

item.title: InterMine Chat (Discord)
item.description: Chat in real time with InterMiners (UK day time) or with the rest of the community. There’s a general chit-chat channel for important stuff like cat pictures, and a support channel for technical queries.

item.title: InterMine Registry
item.description: Need a list of InterMines programmatically? Our Registry Swagger API gives you interactive API documentation, or you can browse a list of InterMines if you prefer.

item.title: InterMine on GitHub
item.description: This is where the code lives! Feel free to fork, star, make issues and bug reports, or even make a pull request if you have a fix or feature for us.

item.title: Making data FAIR using InterMine
item.description: This grant is funded by the BBSRC, and runs for three years starting July 2017, with a focus on making InterMine and its data more FAIR - that is, Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable. Read more in our grant launch blog post

item.title: Site Credits
item.description: InterMine Homepage Copyright InterMine 2017 Site This site is generated using the static site generator hugo and hosted on GitHub pages. Icons SVG icons used on the site are courtesy of IcoMoon and academicons (pubmed icon). Organism icons on the home page are made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com.

item.title: Tutorials and videos
item.description: Here’s a short list of video tutorials produced by community members. If you’d like yours added to the list please contact us! FlyMine intro videos - for the Drosophila-minded among us. Thalemine tutorials - A. thaliana-based tutorials. TargetMine tutorials Tutorials for an InterMine designed to help identify drug targets. YeastMine videos - SGD has quite a broad range of tutorials based on S. Cerevisiae data. MouseMine at MGI - M.
